timeline.bodyText: Isn't this rather a configuration error, when the user forgets to specify a bridge in textual configuration?
timeline.author: fwolter

replies.bodyText: A configuration error should prevent the thing from being initialized. But this can also happen if no callback for the bridge is present.
replies.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText:
Just tested it with OH3. The framework isn't preventing the Thing from being initialized when the bridge is missing (text config), although specified in XML.
EDIT: Which callback are you refering to?
replies.author: fwolter

replies.bodyText:
This is a core-bug. @openhab/core-maintainers, WDYT?
The thing callback.
replies.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: Hm, Yes. I think it is. It is at least worse to open an issue in OHC for discussion.
replies.author: cweitkamp

timeline.bodyText: If I see correctly this happens when the user configures a Bridge of wrong type.
